@ matthew_d_green tl;dr: Mike Hearn was asking for the impossible, assuming you want Bitcoin to be decentralized. That's why he was ignored.
@ matthew_d_green That was my talk at Scaling Bitcoin: In adversarial environments, blockchains don't scale:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ivgxcEOyWNs&feature=youtu.be&t=30m45s …
@ brianchoffman @ matthew_d_green viacoin is the same protcol as Bitcoin. (and I was never worked on it they hired me to work on Bitcoin Core)
@ matthew_d_green Remember that the disagreement between Hearn and the devs is that Hearn wanted to *keep* the current Bitcoin protocol.
@ matthew_d_green For example, @ pwuille's segregated witnesses is a major upgrade everyone is working on right now:https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0141.mediawiki#Specification …
@ matthew_d_green Well, yeah, it has inherently O(n^2) scalability - the Bitcoin Core scaling roadmap is all about upgrading the protocol.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein FWIW, I'm hoping to actually scale Bitcoin directly with my treechains ideas, but that's at least 2-3 years away.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein Equally building layers on top of Bitcoin is for now the only way we know how to do low-cost, low-regulation payments.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein Sure, but those people are probably served by different technology than what Bitcoin itself is good at.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein Mike's on-blockchain scaling proposals mean very few people participate in Bitcoin's operation/governance.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein Keep in mind that we've learned a *lot* about Bitcoin since the whitepaper; many initial ideas turned out insecure.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein SN built in the beginnings of low-cost layers above Bitcoin; we've finishing those layers and are working to deploy.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein For instance, about 95% of the Bitcoin development community signed a concrete scaling plan: https://bitcoin.org/en/bitcoin-core/capacity-increases …
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein If you want that kind of system, there's lots of ways to do it better, even on top of Bitcoin.
@ BLR13 @ MarcHochstein Mike's goals for Bitcoin had nearly 100% focus on low-cost, and nearly zero focus on censorship resistance.
@ anguschampion No white paper's per-se; I do have some fairly technical writeups on the btc-dev mailing list: https://www.mail-archive.com/bitcoin-development@lists.sourceforge.net/msg06570.html …
@ anguschampion Increasing the blocksize is controversial, because increases decrease the number who can participate in governing Bitcoin.
@ anguschampion For instance my CLTV opcode took just a few weeks to get deployed on mainnet after it was released by Bitcoin Core.
